to make it easier for you to run your

every container needs its own unique ip

it's also going to help you to support
other network apps that need many ip

just because it had the ability to

you can add this range to a new or to an
existing

are always in a contiguous range and you
use the the standard
slash addressing for an ipv4 you can
specify a slash 28
prefix so you can have up to 16 ip
addresses per interface
now for ipv6 you can specify a slash 80
interface or prefix
so that means you could theoretically
have up to 16 million ip addresses
per interface the prefixes cannot

data brew unfortunately one of our only

so the reason we have this is before you
take that data and use it to do your
your analytics or to do your machine
learning training the data might be

so with data brew you can do some

different transformations
you can do format conversion you can fix

valid values and all the kind of things

improve the quality of your data so it

a
whole bunch of recent additions to aws
